benchmark_details.name: TSV360
benchmark_details.overview: TSV360 is a dataset for text-driven saliency detection in 360-degree videos, consisting of approximately 16,000 triples of ERP frames, textual descriptions, and ground-truth saliency maps enabling the training and evaluation of such methods.
benchmark_details.data_type: triplets of ERP frames, textual descriptions, ground-truth saliency maps

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of TSV360 is to facilitate research on text-driven saliency detection methods in 360-degree videos.

data.source: TSV360 dataset is derived from VR-EyeTracking and Sports-360 datasets comprising diverse 360-degree video content.
data.annotation: Ground-truth saliency maps were obtained through standardization and Gaussian filtering of fixation annotations.

methods: Qualitative evaluations based on visual observations
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing the machine-generated and ground-truth saliency maps.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the model's effectiveness at predicting salient regions aligned with input textual descriptions.
methodology.baseline_results: Use of the SalViT360 method as a baseline.
methodology.validation: 5-fold cross-validation with 80% training data and 20% testing data.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent was obtained from participants involved in video capture.
